They say: "I have nothing to give to this enterprise; for I shall receive no returns. In paying to the lodge, I am providing for the future, and, besides this, I must bear my share of expense for the entertainments that gratify my taste. I cannot give up these enjoyments. Why does the church look to me to help meet these constantly recurring demands? 'Lord, I knew thee that thou art an hard man, reaping where thou hast not sown, and gathering where 
                                                                           135
thou hast not strawed: and I was afraid, and went and hid thy talent in the earth' [Matthew 25:24, 25], expecting that some time I would be benefited by it."
